sen.j: 鈴鹿王（すずかのおおきみ、生年不詳 - 天平17年9月4日 (旧暦)（745年10月17日））は、奈良時代の皇族。
sen.e: Suzuka no Okimi (date of birth unknown, died on October 17, 745) was an Imperial Family member during the Nara Period.
Suzuka no Okimi (year of birth unknown - October 17, 745) was an Imperial Family member during the Nara period.
sen.cmt: カッコ内を修正しました。Period→period と修正しました。
sen.e: Suzuka no Okimi (year of birth unknown - October 17, 745) was an Imperial Family member during the Nara period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 父は天武天皇皇子の高市皇子で兄に長屋王がいる。
sen.e: His father was Prince Takechi, a son of Emperor Tenmu and Nagayao (Prince Nagaya) was his elder brother.
His father was the Prince Takechi, a son of the Emperor Tenmu and Nagayao (the Prince Nagaya) was his older brother.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。elder→older と修正しました。
sen.e: His father was the Prince Takechi, a son of the Emperor Tenmu and Nagayao (the Prince Nagaya) was his older brother.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 天平元年（729年）に勃発した長屋王の変後も昇進を続け、天平3年（731年）8月11日参議に任ぜられた。
sen.e: Even after the Nagayao no Hen (Conspiracy of Nagayao) in 729, he was continuously promoted and was appointed Sangi (counselor of Daijokan (Council of State)) on August 11, 731.
Even after the Nagayao no Hen (Conspiracy of Nagayao) in 729, he was continuously promoted and was appointed Sangi (counselor of Daijokan [Council of State]) on September 20, 731.
sen.cmt: appointed→appointed to,カッコ内のカッコ、スペースを修正しました。天平3年（731年）8月11日→西暦731年9月20日と修正しました。
sen.e: Even after the Nagayao no Hen (Conspiracy of Nagayao) in 729, he was continuously promoted and was appointed Sangi (counselor of Daijokan [Council of State]) on September 20, 731.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 天平9年（737年）、藤原四兄弟（藤原武智麻呂、藤原房前、藤原宇合、藤原麻呂）の死去を受け、太政大臣に任ぜられ、大納言橘諸兄と共に政権を運営する。
sen.e: Following the deaths of the Fujiwara four brothers (FUJIWARA no Muchimaro, FUJIWARA no Fusasaki, FUJIWARA no Umakai and FUJIWARA no Maro), he was appointed Chidaijoukanji (a deputy to the Dajo Daijin) in 737, and came to be in charge of political affairs together with TACHIBANA no Moroe, the then Dainagon (Major Counselor of the Daijokan).
sen.cmt: 「太政大臣に任ぜられ」は、この後ろの文脈との整合性を考えると、正しくは「知太政官事に任せられ」だと思いますので、そのように翻訳しました。
sen.e: Following the deaths of the four Fujiwara brothers (FUJIWARA no Muchimaro, FUJIWARA no Fusasaki, FUJIWARA no Umakai and FUJIWARA no Maro), he was appointed to Chidaijokanji (a deputy to the Dajo Daijin) in 737, and came to be in charge of political affairs together with TACHIBANA no Moroe, the then Dainagon (Major Counselor of the Daijokan).
sen.cmt: スペースの修正をしました。Fujiwara four→four Fujiwara,appointed→appointed to,Chidajoukanji→Chidajokanji と修正しました。
sen.e: Following the deaths of the four Fujiwara brothers (FUJIWARA no Muchimaro, FUJIWARA no Fusasaki, FUJIWARA no Umakai and FUJIWARA no Maro), he was appointed to Chidaijokanji (a deputy to the Dajo Daijin) in 737, and came to be in charge of political affairs together with TACHIBANA no Moroe, the then Dainagon (Major Counselor of the Daijokan).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 一説に、こうした鈴鹿王の立身の背景には、無念の思いを抱いて死んだ長屋王の霊を鎮めたいという朝廷の意図が込められていたといわれているが、その一方で天平9年の疫病によって議政官級の皇族・貴族のほとんどが死去してしまい、大臣に就任できる要件を満たした人材がいなくなってしまったために、大臣と同格で皇族であることが唯一の条件であった知太政官事を急遽立てなければならないという切迫した事情も介在していた。
sen.e: While there is a theory that such speedy promotion of Suzuka no Okimi was the results of the Imperial Court's influence, who intended to appease the spirit of Nagayao, who died feeling mortified, another theory says that as the plague in 737 killed most members of the imperial family and nobilities working in the Giseikan (Legislature), leaving very few princes and nobilities meeting requirements to fill ministerial positions, there was a desperate need to quickly fill in the position of Chidaijouikanji whose only requirement was being a member of the Imperial Family and in a position equivalent to the ministers.

sen.j: 天平16年（744年）には藤原仲麻呂と共に恭仁宮複都制に任命されるが、翌年没した。
sen.e: In 744 he was appointed Kuninomiya Rusukan (an officer to guard Kuninomiya (currently Kizugawa City, Kyoto Prefecture) while master is away) together with FUJIWARA no Nakama ro, but died in the following year.

sen.j: 『続日本紀』によると佐紀にあった鈴鹿王邸に、宝亀元年（770年）孝謙天皇称徳天皇の御陵が造営されたという。
sen.e: According to Shoku Nihongi (Chronicle of Japan Continued), in 770 the Misasagi (Imperial mausoleum) of Empress Koken (later Empress Shotoku) was build on the premises of former Suzuka no Okimi's house located in Saki.

sen.j: 鈴鹿王の没後、王の子である出雲王・奄智王らはいずれも豊野真人の氏姓を賜り、臣籍降下した。
sen.e: After the death of Suzuka no Okimi, his sons, Isumoo (Prince Izumo) and Enchio (Prince Enchi) were both granted the family name of Toyono Mahito and demoted to the status of subject.
